WRITING.TITLE: To keep or not to keep my ships [XBOX]
WRITING.TEXT:
I now have more ships than I do have slots. I have dry docked two lower tier ships (and trashed the gear that they had (super low level stuff). I can't decide if I should dry dock / get rid of them, as in all likelihood I don't fly them again. My dilemma is that I've been using my old ships as parts storage. If I dry dock them I don't have the space for all those parts. Also I want to get the dilithium ships from the ship req person as I want the admiralty cards.
The main question is is there any reason to keep most of the lower tier ships?
I know I can buy more ship slots, but not sure if that is the best use of my resources as zen isn't exactly cheap.
I'm on console so don't have all the ships yet, but we have the T5U Avenger and if the Arbiter is like the Avenger that is what I would go with. (That is what I'm waiting for on console)

There is an info graphic maybe a month ago of what episode ties into mission arc of the story. If you want to get the references I say watch those episodes. To get you immersed in the universe.
http://trekmovie.com/2016/09/22/infographic-where-does-star-trek-online-fit-into-canon/
Edit: found the link.
But has been scoring double digits consecutively for seven seasons.

WRITING.TITLE: How do you pick your starship registry number
WRITING.TEXT: I was curious about what other people do to pick their registry number. So far I've just let it go randomly. Using my bday or something similar just didn't appeal to me.
Xbox and iphone in the same sentence... Cringe.

For anyone looking for EC without spending money, do tour the galaxy, you get 25,000 EC for each system you visit. With a average engine setup (lvl 52+) and basic slipstream you can get about 500K EC each day.
Also if you use bing rewards you get points for searching with bing which you can redeem for xbox gift card which you can use for Zen. Yes it takes time and commitment but it is essentially free Zen.
Most likely because the engine doesn't allow for such.

WRITING.TITLE: Strategy and goals for recruiting?
WRITING.TEXT: What is the ideal process for recruiting? I know in console there is a lot of blind recruiting, are we looking to be different. Or is it better to recruit a large number of people hoping some of them will join?
After you roll doesn't it stop for a split second before moving again?
Just remember some of those that didn't get options picked up could be resigned at a different rate.
On console I have found that if you jump, you must wait until you have landed for it to stop or else you keep sliding.

I'm sure I'm late to the game, and others have said this, but in short. Stick to one weapon type (beams, or cannons; aa you are in a cruiser I suggest single beam arrays as they have the largest attack arc) and one type of damage (phaser, polaron, anti proton, so that you can apply consoles to boost all your weapons with each). If you need to gain a certain weapon I suggest replaying a mission that rewards it over and over again until you get enough of those weapons.
Plus I think Tarbell is on a GA contract do his salary doesn't count against the cap.
When you have Bingham and Tarbell as 1 2 keeper, whoever they bring in will be bench warming, so a HGP wouldn't be terrible to get some practice experience.
So really no point replaying missions right now.
